task_summary: Perceive the T-shaped block and the goal mark, approach and align the circular tool to the block, establish contact, push the T toward the fixed target, verify arrival, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed-base manipulator with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block to a drawn goal mark on a tabletop. The contact sheet shows approach, contact, and a progressive push that aligns the block with the target outline. The behavior emphasizes reliable perception, gentle contact establishment, and a straight push along the table plane. The scene includes a single T-shaped block, a goal outline on the table, and the robot tool.
preconditions: Workspace is clear except for one T-shaped block and a visible target outline
Robot tool center is calibrated to the camera frame
Table friction sufficient to prevent excessive slip
stepwise_plan: Detect the T-shaped block and the target outline
Move above the block; align the tool to the push face
Push the block in the goal direction
Verify the block is at the target
success_criteria: Block pose overlaps the goal mark within visual tolerance
No object dropped off the table
Robot ends in a safe, non-contact pose
failure_and_recovery: If contact not established: re-approach and lower again
If push deviates: re-align and push a shorter distance
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the block is verified at target and the robot has retreated.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Checks if a named object is currently visible.
Run perception to localize target; writes pose to BB.
Move TCP above the target with vertical offset.
Plan a lateral approach and align tool to push face.
Descend slowly until contact is detected.
Planar push of the target along a set direction and distance.
Checks if current object pose matches named goal.
Back off from contact to a safe standoff.

failure_modes: Perception fails to localize block or target
recovery_strategy: Fallback to Detect when object not visible
Re-approach and re-align before pushing again
Use shorter pushes and re-verify goal proximity
assumptions: Frames show a red T and a blue target outline; instruction colors (gray/green/blue) differ—treated as semantic equivalents for block/goal/tool.
Push direction set to 90° based on apparent table orientation; true world frame may differ.

expected_success_criteria: T-block centered within the goal outline after push
Robot not in contact at end of episode
